p: Clinical symptoms: elderly and patients in a poor condition are more likely to have severe progression and longer diarrhoea and can shed viruses for a very long time [ 1, 4, 14, 17– 19]. Symptoms include nausea, vomiting (2–3 days), diarrhoea (2–5 days), incontinence and fever 38–39 °C, of approximately 2–3 days duration.
